description: In a triangle of numbers (such as that in A059032, A059033, A059034) how many entries lie above position (n,k)? Answer: T(n,k) = (n+1)*(k+1)-1 (n >= 0, k >= 0).
comments: As a square array read by anti-diagonals, this has e.g.f. exp(x+y)(x+y+xy). - _Paul Barry_, Sep 24 2004
formula: T(n, k) = max{T(n-1, k-1), T(n-1, k)} + min{k, n-k+1} - _Jon Perry_, Aug 05 2004Row sums = Sum{k=0..n} T(n-k, k) = A005581(n+1). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 28 2015T(n, k) = T(k, n) = T(-2-n, -2-k) for all n, k in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 28 2015Sum_{n, k >= 0} x^T(n, k) = f(x) / x where f() is the g.f. for A000005. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 28 2015
prog: (PARI) {T(n, k) = n + k + n*k}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 28 2015 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 13 2001
